department.ch: 學習與教學研究所碩士班

goal.en:
"1.Through a careful literature review, this course will first summarize the crucial components of Bloom’s taxonomy table that led to the formation, implementing, and assessing of a course.
2.Use case studies to bring in the empirical research and pedagogical knowledge demonstrate how to align the objectives, instruction, and assessment for multiple disciplinary faculties across campus."

content.en:
"1.Set the Stage
2.Structure, Specificity, and Problems of Objectives
3.Unsolved Problems
4.Taxonomy Table
5.Knowledge Dimension
6.Cognitive Process Dimension
7.Addressing Long-Standing Problems in Classroom Instruction
8.Mid-term exam
9.Using the Taxonomy Table
10.Introduction to the Vignettes:Domestic vs. Textbook cases
11.To be announce
12.Seven Best Principles for Interdisciplinary T & L (1)
13.Seven Best Princeples for Interdisciplinary T & L (2)
14.Unsolved Problems
15.Oral Check-Up and Cheers
16.Final project due"

textbook.en:
"1.By learning the practical techniques and ideas which have implemented successfully by 100 award-winning teachers in the Compendium of Suggestions for Teaching with Excellence in the University of Berkeley, students will be able to adopted to wide range of classroom settings.
2.Davis, B. G. (2001). Tools for Teaching. San Francisco: Jossey-Bass Higher and Adult Education Series."
